decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the Urzatron lands and using powerful Eldrazi creatures, along with Karn, the Great Creator, for control and disruption. The main strategy is to lock down the opponent's cards with Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust, while also providing threats with Thought-Knot Seer and World Breaker. The deck utilizes a mix of artifacts and creatures to provide a versatile game plan, and aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and powerful control elements.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to quickly combo off and win the game. By utilizing artifact cards and the Breach ability, players can easily churn through their deck and find a win condition, such as Thassa's Oracle. The key is to control the game early on with disruption like Unholy Heat and Malevolent Rumble, while setting up the combo pieces needed for a quick win. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and control.

The deck aims to control the game by using various Eldrazi creatures and powerful spells to disrupt opponents' strategies and ultimately overwhelm them. It utilizes ramp and mana acceleration tools like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Curiosity to quickly cast high-cost Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Cards like Kozilek's Return and All Is Dust provide board wipes, while Karn, the Great Creator and The One Ring offer additional utility and versatility. The deck is designed to maintain board presence and outvalue opponents through its Eldrazi synergy and control elements.

This Mardu Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells, supported by powerful planeswalkers and utility cards. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds consistency and a potential late-game threat. With a focus on quick, aggressive plays, the deck looks to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the board throughout the game. By leveraging a mix of creatures, spells, and lands, the deck seeks to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, all while utilizing powerful anthem effects from cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Blood Moon to hinder the opponent's game plan. By curving out with early threats like Guide of Souls and Amped Raptor, followed by larger threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge provide reach and removal, ensuring the deck can handle a variety of threats.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on using powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to control the board while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Boggart Trawler to put pressure on the opponent while generating value. Additionally, cards like Soul Spike and Necrodominance provide the deck with powerful finishers to close out the game. The overall strategy is to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure a victory.

The key concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly with cards like Ruby Medallion, Desperate Ritual, and Pyretic Ritual, while using Questing Druid and Ral, Monsoon Mage to dig for combo pieces. The goal is to cast spells like Grapeshot and Wish multiple times in a single turn to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent. Past in Flames allows for recursion of key cards, while Valakut Awakening can help with card selection. The deck aims to win the game through a explosive combo turn that overwhelms the opponent's defenses.

The main concept of this Modern Control UrzaTron deck is centered around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a lot of mana quickly. This enables the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and World Breaker. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust to control the board, while Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to control the game with powerful creatures and spells while utilizing the UrzaTron lands for mana advantage.

This deck focuses on aggressively ramping up damage output with a combination of low-cost creatures like Wild Nacatl and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, backed up by powerful threats like Nishoba Brawler and Scion of Draco. Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt are used to control the board and finish off opponents, while Leyline cards provide additional utility and protection. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility to the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of speed, power, and resilience.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo between Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Grinding Station, and Underworld Breach to generate infinite mana and mill the opponent's library. It also includes disruption elements like Malevolent Rumble and removal like Unholy Heat to control the game. Urza's Saga is used to tutor key pieces of the combo, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to streamline its game plan and win quickly with the combo while using various utility lands to support its strategy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and gaining card advantage. The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects. The win condition is to eventually play a powerful threat like Murktide Regent and protect it with additional counterspells and removal spells until the opponent runs out of resources. The deck operates on a tight mana base and aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient use of resources.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to accelerate mana production, allowing for the quick casting of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes control elements like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Return to deal with threats, while also utilizing cards like Malevolent Rumble to clear the board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats while controlling the board and maintaining card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with infect abilities to quickly deal damage to opponents and win the game. By combining pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Scale Up with protection spells like Blossoming Defense and Vines of Vastwood, the deck aims to make its infect creatures unstoppable. The inclusion of Duress helps to disrupt opponent's strategies, while mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Ignoble Hierarch allows for quicker plays. The land base is designed to provide consistent mana sources for the deck's powerful spells.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to utilize ritual spells and mana fixing to quickly generate a large amount of red mana, allowing the player to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible. The deck also features cards like Wish and Past in Flames to recycle resources and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency to the deck. Overall, the strategy focuses on explosive combos and efficient resource management to overwhelm opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Wrath of the Skies to dominate the game. The key card, The One Ring, acts as a versatile tool that can provide resources or removal options depending on the situation. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Galvanic Discharge offer additional threats and removal spells to maintain board control. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption against the opponent's plans, while cards like Solitude and Subtlety offer flexibility in dealing with threats. The deck aims to outlast opponents with superior resource management and strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer, while utilizing the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to ramp up and cast big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also focuses on disruption and removal with cards like Kozilek's Command and Dismember. The inclusion of The One Ring and Talisman of Resilience provides additional consistency and protection. Overall, the deck aims to dominate the board and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and control elements.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively pressure the opponent using a mix of powerful creature threats and efficient removal spells. By deploying a diverse range of creatures like Scion of Draco, Territorial Kavu, and Ocelot Pride alongside impactful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, cards like Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional reach and resilience. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Damping Sphere helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing this aggro deck to dictate the pace of the game.

The deck utilizes the synergy between land ramp spells like Explore and Amulet of Vigor to quickly assemble the powerful Primeval Titan combo. By utilizing multiple lands that produce multiple mana such as The One Ring and Gruul Turf, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana to ramp into big threats like Cultivator Colossus and Hanweir Battlements. The inclusion of Expedition Map and Tolaria West also allows the deck to search for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for additional win conditions. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and efficient land ramp.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing their creatures, and drawing cards while gradually building up a powerful board presence with evasive threats like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas. The deck utilizes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish dominance on the battlefield. By efficiently managing resources and responding to threats effectively, this Dimir Control deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

Utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage and controlling the board. With efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters, along with the ability to dig for key cards using Preordain and Consider, this deck excels at maintaining tempo and out-valuing the opponent. By carefully managing resources and making strategic decisions, this Dimir Control deck seeks to grind out incremental advantages and ultimately secure victory through attrition and careful play.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return provide board control, while Kozilek's Command offers versatility. The deck also includes cards like All Is Dust for mass removal and Ancient Stirrings for card selection. The goal is to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures, using the mana acceleration provided by the deck's ramp cards.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that cycle through the deck quickly, such as Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries, to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures. By casting Living End, the player can then bring all of these creatures back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming the opponent with a sudden flood of creatures. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Endurance and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also featuring counterspells like Force of Negation to protect its combo. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with a mix of creatures and spells, aiming to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It utilizes powerful creatures such as Amped Raptor and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also supporting them with cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Orcish Bowmasters. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment adds a direct damage element to the strategy. The deck also features disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Static Prison to hinder the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional utility and flexibility to the deck.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, using a mix of powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck features a variety of creatures with abilities that can increase their power and toughness, as well as disruptive spells like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional reach and finishers to close out the game. The deck also includes a companion in Jegantha, the Wellspring for additional versatility and mana fixing.

This deck focuses on aggressively gaining life with cards like Martyr of Sands and Skyclave Apparition to fuel powerful effects like Solitude and Sevinne's Reclamation. The deck also includes a minor land destruction element with cards like Ghost Quarter and Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to dominate the game by gaining life, removing threats, and maintaining board control to secure victory.

mainboard.name: Vito, Thorn of the Dusk Rose

decks.notes: This Mono Black Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful creature removal spells, hand disruption, and graveyard interaction to control the game and outvalue opponents. The deck features a variety of win conditions, including Orcish Bowmasters and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while utilizing cards like Necrodominance and Soul Spike for additional value. By stripping away opponent's resources and deploying powerful threats, the deck aims to grind out opponents and win through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana with spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, while reducing the cost of spells with Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage. By casting spells to draw cards and gain mana, the deck aims to eventually cast Past in Flames to re-cast all spells in the graveyard and finish off the opponent with a massive Grapeshot. The inclusion of cards like Wish, Strike It Rich, and Glimpse the Impossible provide additional versatility and ways to dig for combo pieces. The deck is designed to win through a fast and explosive combo before the opponent can establish a defense.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through ritual spells and mana-doubling effects to cast high-impact spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot. It also utilizes card draw to dig for combo pieces and recursion effects like Past in Flames to bring back key spells from the graveyard. The inclusion of Wish adds versatility to the deck by allowing access to a sideboard of powerful one-of cards. The deck aims to chain spells together to generate a lethal storm count and overwhelm the opponent in a single explosive turn.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal, while utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage and Timeless Dragon to apply pressure. The key card is The One Ring, which allows the player to repeatedly return cards from their graveyard to their hand for value. The deck also includes various utility cards like Tamiyo and Teferi to help find answers and maintain control of the battlefield. The land base is designed to allow for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

The main focus of this UR Control deck is to control the board through counterspells and removal spells, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Magus of the Moon and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to generate card advantage and outvalue the opponent. By controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through its powerful late-game threats and card advantage engines.
